name: Narial Jheenga (Bombay Coconut Shrimps)
keywords: coriander, cumin, garlic, ginger, lemon juice, shrimp, unsweetened coconut flakes, low-fat, main course
recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound medium-large shrimps (about 14 to 16), shelled and deveined, tails intact
1/2 teaspoon crushed or grated fresh ginger

recipeInstructions.text: Spread out the coconut flakes in a 10-inch microwave-proof pie plate or dish. Toast, uncovered, at 100 percent power in a 650- to 700-watt microwave carousel oven for 3 to 5 minutes, or until lightly golden. Stir once during the cooking time. (The coconut will color unevenly.) Remove from the oven and set aside to cool.

Place the shrimps in a bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well to coat the shrimps. Lift the shrimps by their tails and dip them one at a time in the toasted coconut. Coat them evenly but lightly. Arrange the shrimps in the microwave-proof pie plate or dish, petal fashion, with the tails toward the center of the pan.
Cook, covered, at 100 percent power in the microwave oven for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the shrimps are just done. They should be pink and firm. Remove and serve.
